snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes many items on the SOPA protests including the blackout day in song and comics, a survey on technology spendin...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes many items on the SOPA protests including the blackout day in song and comics, a survey on technology spending and a story about a civil war in California and its metaphoric implications.

headline.main: Before Tearing Out a Wall, Check Your Phone
headline.print_headline: Before Tearing Out a Wall, Check Your Phone

snippet: According to a new research report from Nielsen, there were so many purchases of iPhones around the holidays that Apple sharply whittled down the market share lead of Android smartphones in the United States by the end of the year. In December, le...
abstract: According to a new research report from Nielsen, there were so many purchases of iPhones around the holidays that Apple sharply whittled down the market share lead of Android smartphones in the United States by the end of the year. In December, less than three percentage points separated the share of Android devices and iPhones among new smartphone owners.

headline.main: Gap Narrows Between Android and iPhone
headline.print_headline: Androids Lose Market Share To the iPhone

abstract: According to a new research report from Nielsen, there were so many purchases of iPhones around the holidays that Apple sharply whittled down the market share lead of Android smartphones in the United States by the end of the year. In December, less than three percentage points separated the share of Android devices and iPhones among new smartphone owners.

headline.main: Gap Narrows Between Android and iPhone

snippet: Visa has added support for making wireless payments through some smartphones, which would replace its plastic cards. But wireless Visa payments will initially work at only 150,000 retail locations in the United States.
abstract: Visa has added support for making wireless payments through some smartphones, which would replace its plastic cards. But wireless Visa payments will initially work at only 150,000 retail locations in the United States.

headline.main: A Digital Wallet Now Available on Some Smartphones

snippet: Visa, the credit card company, has added support for making wireless payments through some smartphones, which would replace its plastic cards. But wireless Visa payments will initially work at only 150,000 retail locations in the United States eve...
abstract: Visa, the credit card company, has added support for making wireless payments through some smartphones, which would replace its plastic cards. But wireless Visa payments will initially work at only 150,000 retail locations in the United States even though Visa has about 8 million merchants.

headline.main: A Digital Wallet Now Available on Some Smartphones

snippet: Using the alt-tab combination on Windows (or command-tab on Macs) allows you to quickly jump from one application to another.
abstract: Using the alt-tab combination on Windows (or command-tab on Macs) allows you to quickly jump from one application to another.
